required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Data Visualization of Kidney and Prostate Tumors Using Routine Pre-Operative Imaging, 3D Printed, and 3D Virtual Reality Models
clinical_study.official_title: Data Visualization of Kidney and Prostate Tumors Using Routine Pre-Operative Imaging, 3D Printed, and 3D Virtual Reality Models

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether adding new methods of data visualization to routine clinical care will improve (i) surgical planning and (ii) surgical outcomes in patients with kidney and prostate tumors.

detailed_description.textblock: This early phase I trial studies how well indwelling pleural catheters with doxycycline work compared to indwelling pleural catheters alone in treating participants with malignant pleural effusions. These types of catheters are commonly used to treat pleural effusions (build-up of fluid in the lungs). Doxycycline is an antibiotic that is also used to treat pleural effusions. It is not yet known whether giving doxycycline with indwelling pleural catheters works better than indwelling pleural catheters alone in treating participants with cancerous pleural effusions.

primary_outcome.description: measure of the amount of time it takes surgeon to remove tumor

arm_group.arm_group_label: Routine imaging such as CT or MRI
arm_group.description: Subjects will undergo routine pre-operative imaging and will be randomized into 3 groups for data visualization. This group will receive data visualization using routine clinical imaging,

arm_group.arm_group_label: Routine imaging (CT or MRI) with a 3D printed model
arm_group.description: Subjects will undergo routine pre-operative imaging and will be randomized into 3 groups for data visualization. This group will receive data visualization using routine clinical imaging with a 3D printed anatomical mode

arm_group.arm_group_label: Routine imaging (CT or MRI) with a VR model
arm_group.description: Subjects will undergo routine pre-operative imaging and will be randomized into 3 groups for data visualization. This group will receive data visualization using routine clinical imaging with a 3D VR anatomical model

intervention.description: CAT (Computerized Axial Tomography) scan, is a noninvasive X-ray test that is used to diagnose a variety of medical conditions.
intervention.arm_group_label: Routine imaging such as CT or MRI

intervention.intervention_name: Routine imaging CT with a 3D printed model
intervention.description: CAT (Computerized Axial Tomography) scan, is a noninvasive X-ray test that is used to diagnose a variety of medical conditions + 3D Printed Model
intervention.arm_group_label: Routine imaging (CT or MRI) with a 3D printed model

intervention.intervention_name: Routine imaging MRI with a 3D printed model
intervention.description: will measure post-operative lesion volume as visualized on the post-operative MRI + 3D Printed Model
intervention.arm_group_label: Routine imaging (CT or MRI) with a 3D printed model

intervention.description: will measure post-operative lesion volume as visualized on the post-operative MRI
intervention.arm_group_label: Routine imaging such as CT or MRI

intervention.intervention_name: Routine imaging CT with a VR model
intervention.description: CAT (Computerized Axial Tomography) scan, is a noninvasive X-ray test that is used to diagnose a variety of medical conditions + VR Model
intervention.arm_group_label: Routine imaging (CT or MRI) with a VR model

intervention.intervention_name: Routine imaging MRI with a VR model
intervention.description: will measure post-operative lesion volume as visualized on the post-operative MRI + VR Model
intervention.arm_group_label: Routine imaging (CT or MRI) with a VR model

study_pop.textblock: Patients who have scheduled to have kidney or prostate cancer surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Outpatients with MPE undergoing IPC placement
- Sufficient mental capacity to provide informed consent and answer Short-Form Six-Dimension health index (SF-6D) and Borg score questions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing pleurodesis for benign disease (e.g., spontaneous pneumothorax)
- Inability or unwillingness to give informed consent
- Inability to perform phone call and clinical follow-up at MD Anderson Cancer Center (MDACC)
- Pregnancy
- Previous intrapleural therapy for MPE on the same side
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) of 4 and life expectancy â‰¤ 2 weeks
- Doxycycline allergy
- Extensive loculations or hydropneumothorax or other contraindication to pleurodesis
- Chylous effusions associated with malignant disease

facility.name: New York University School of Medicine
